page.title: 19Housing in Wroughton
page.content: Wroughton is a fast growing village South of Swindon to where many of the village's inhabitants travel to work every day. The village can be divided into two distinct parts _ Old Wroughton and New Wroughton _ the dividing line being the a361 road which travels up the scarp slope on its way to Devizes. The original site of Wroughton is at the foot of the steep scarp slope. It grew here because spring water was available. Today the oldest areas are called The Pitchens, Bakers Row and Green Lane and it is here that some of the old thatched cottages still exist. To the West of the a361 Wroughton has extended over the Clay Vale in the form of Post War Housing estates.
